alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:02PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Natrona and south central Johnson Counties through 345 PM MDT... At 302 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Red Wall, which is also 21 miles southwest of Kaycee, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Natrona and south central Johnson Counties. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 222 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains Southeast; Natrona County Lower Elevations; Southeast Johnson County
